alert.note: Alert for Coffee; Geneva (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 6:33AM CDT until further notice by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Alabama, including the following counties, Coffee and Geneva. * WHEN...Until 815 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 633 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen in the last 2 Hours. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elba, Kinston, Ino, Holley Store, Alberton, Goodman, Marvin Chapel, New Haven, Perry Store, Rhoades, Turner Crossroads, Basin, Weeks, Lowery and Spears. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
